awd_titl_txt: Optimal State Estimation for Tubular Reactors with          Multiple Time Domains and Dynamic Measurements
awd_abstract_narration: This work involves the application of sophisticated control theory to           pilot-scale packed-bed tubular reactors.  The results are expected to           provide data for control schemes that result in more economically and           energetically efficient operation and a technique to eliminate                  potential hot spots which are sometimes problems in catalyst-packed             tubular reactors.  Numerical and analytical solutions of the                    mathematical representations that describe the system are planned.              These results will be checked with experimental results obtained on a           one-inch tubular packed-bed styrene reactor.  The research will thus            provide real time demonstration on a real reactor of the theoretical            solution proposed.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
